name: Reflect, Refract, Escape
description: Educational multiplayer puzzle video game, designed to teach light optics to high school students. Developed algorithms to handle light-ray reflections and refractions. Completed for research at the University of Toronto. Play-test data (from a collection of testers that included current high-school students) was analyzed to conclude the optimal game design elements for educational games.

name: stewesho.me
description: That's this very site! This is hosted on GitHub Pages and is open source.

name: Slymes
description: Online multiplayer arena game (similar to agar.io). Players control a "Slyme" through wide open 3-D spaces, collecting food to grow larger and absorbing other players with smaller Slymes. Project involved devloping game mechanics, inventory management, online netplay, and graphical interfaces.

name: Radial Bracket Generator
description: [Under Development]: Web-app that generates a radial tournament bracket. User may input custom teams, and the app will automatically seed and generate the tournament. Users can advance and relegate teams within their bracket, and tournament brackets can be saved to the app database. Frontend is created in React, and backend API is created using Flask and MongoDB (subject to changes)

name: Reso Crawler
description: Procedurely-generated dungeon crawler where the size of the screen is the player's healthbar; the more damage they've taken, the less they can see. Developed from scratch in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 42 game jam, where it was voted as one of the top 100 most innovative entries.

name: Prepenol
description: Shoot-em' up game for Android mobile devices. Player uses on-screen controls to guide their spaceship, collecting powerups and shooting an endless guantlet of different enemies. Developed completely from scratch in Corona SDK, and is available on the Google Play Store.

name: Voyageur Transit Mnager
description: Desktop client that manages trips taken on transit systems. Coded in Java with UI designed with JavaFX. Users can create pre-paid transit cards that they can use to take trips between stations, while admin users can track rider statistics. Completed in group of 4 as part of a Software Design course at the University of Toronto.
